thread.title: Edmonton man, 28, charged with breaking woman’s arms with crow bar in road-rage attack
thread.title_full: Edmonton man, 28, charged with breaking woman’s arms with crow bar in road-rage attack

author: The Canadian Press
title: Edmonton man, 28, charged with breaking woman’s arms with crow bar in road-rage attack
text:
EDMONTON — A 28-year-old man has been charged after a woman’s arms were broken in what police say was a road-rage attack.
Police say a 34-year-old woman honked her horn as she was passing a car that was stopped on a residential street where she was trying to make a turn early Tuesday morning.
The car, described by police as a silver Pontiac Wave, followed her to a house.
When she got out of her vehicle, police say, the man ran up to her, striking her on both arms with a crowbar.
The woman was taken to hospital and underwent surgery.
Related Dashcam images in ‘vicious’ road-rage attack that broke woman’s arms came from victim’s vehicle Jared Matthew Eliasson is to appear in court on Monday on charges of attempt to commit murder, possess offensive weapon dangerous to public, and aggravated assault.
“No road rage is acceptable, but when you have a mother who was just on her way home after dropping off her husband at work when she encountered this violent individual, you know it gives us all pause in the police service,” said police spokesman Scott Pattison.
Edmonton police The vehicle driven by a road rage suspect in Edmonton, in an image taken from a dashboard camera video.
